Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 2 wickets (with 4 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: Experts noted that both teams have been struggling in recent T20 matches, with Sri Lanka losing 10 of their last 14 and Bangladesh losing 14 of their last 16 completed games.
Kusal Mendis has been in excellent Test-match form recently and has extended that to the shortest format, dominating Sri Lanka's premier T20 domestic tournament.

Mahedi Hasan has been one of the rare consistent performers for Bangladesh in T20s over the last 12 months, having the best economy rate in world cricket among bowlers who have played at least 25 innings.
The match is likely to be played on a used surface, which might be more spin-friendly.
Temperatures will be scorching, likely in the low 30-degree Celsius range, even in the evening.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka have won eight of the 12 completed matches between these teams, but lost two of the last three.
Kusal Mendis has scores of 53, 10, 57, and 11 against Bangladesh, striking at 169 across those four innings.
In five innings in the UAE so far, Mahedi Hasan has taken just three wickets but has been economical, conceding 7.45 an over.
Others: Bangladesh team director Khaled Mahmud expressed concerns about the team's opening pair and emphasized the need for a change in mindset and intent.
